heart-attack.name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
heart-attack.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is suddenly blocked, leading to tissue damage.
symptoms: Pain in arms, neck, jaw, or back
heart-attack.causes: Blockage of coronary arteries due to plaque buildup or blood clots.
heart-attack.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate emergency medical attention if chest pain or severe discomfort occurs.

cardiac-arrest.name: Cardiac Arrest
cardiac-arrest.description: Cardiac arrest occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating, cutting off blood flow to the brain and other vital organs.
cardiac-arrest.causes: Electrical malfunction of the heart causing abnormal rhythm.
cardiac-arrest.when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if a person collapses and is unresponsive.

heart-failure.name: Heart Failure
heart-failure.description: A chronic condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet the body’s needs.
heart-failure.causes: Coronary artery disease, hypertension, or damaged heart muscle.

hypertension.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
hypertension.description: A condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high over time.
hypertension.causes: Genetics, lifestyle factors, excess salt intake.

coronary-artery-disease.name: Coronary Artery Disease
coronary-artery-disease.description: A condition caused by narrowing of coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart.

lung-cancer.name: Lung Cancer
lung-cancer.description: A cancer that begins in the lungs, most commonly associated with smoking.
lung-cancer.causes: Long-term exposure to tobacco smoke or environmental pollutants.
lung-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 3 weeks or coughing blood.

asthma.name: Asthma
asthma.description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing.
asthma.causes: Allergens, exercise, infections, or genetic factors.

bronchitis.name: Bronchitis
bronchitis.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to coughing and mucus production.

pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.

sinusitis.name: Sinusitis
sinusitis.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain and nasal congestion.

copd.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
copd.description: A group of progressive lung diseases that block airflow.
copd.causes: Long-term smoking or exposure to irritants.

allergic-rhinitis.name: Allergic Rhinitis
allergic-rhinitis.description: An allergic reaction causing sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes.
allergic-rhinitis.causes: Exposure to allergens such as pollen or dust.

acid-reflux-gerd.name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
acid-reflux-gerd.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
acid-reflux-gerd.causes: Weak lower esophageal sphincter allowing acid reflux.
prevention_tips: Do not lie down after eating
acid-reflux-gerd.when_to_seek_help: Frequent or severe heartburn not relieved by medication.

gastritis.name: Gastritis
gastritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause pain and nausea.
gastritis.causes: Infection, excessive alcohol use, or prolonged NSAID use.
gastritis.when_to_seek_help: Persistent stomach pain or vomiting blood.

peptic-ulcer.name: Peptic Ulcer
peptic-ulcer.description: Open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or upper small intestine.
peptic-ulcer.causes: Helicobacter pylori infection or long-term NSAID use.
peptic-ulcer.when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain or black stools.

irritable-bowel-syndrome.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
irritable-bowel-syndrome.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping and bowel changes.

jaundice.name: Jaundice
jaundice.description: A condition characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
jaundice.causes: Liver disease, hepatitis, or bile duct obstruction.
jaundice.when_to_seek_help: Sudden yellowing of skin or eyes.

food-poisoning.name: Food Poisoning
food-poisoning.description: Illness caused by eating contaminated food.
food-poisoning.causes: Bacteria, viruses, or parasites in food.

constipation.name: Constipation
constipation.description: A condition where bowel movements become infrequent or difficult.
constipation.causes: Low fiber intake, dehydration, or inactivity.
constipation.when_to_seek_help: Persistent constipation lasting more than 2 weeks.

stroke.name: Stroke
stroke.description: A medical emergency that occurs when blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
symptoms: Sudden weakness on one side of the body
stroke.causes: Blocked or ruptured blood vessels in the brain.
stroke.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency medical attention is required.

migraine.name: Migraine
migraine.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, recurring headaches.
migraine.causes: Neurological triggers, hormonal changes, and stress.
migraine.when_to_seek_help: Severe or frequent headaches disrupting daily life.

epilepsy.name: Epilepsy
epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.
epilepsy.causes: Brain injury, genetic factors, or infections.

parkinsons-disease.name: Parkinson’s Disease
parkinsons-disease.description: A progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement.

alzheimers-disease.name: Alzheimer’s Disease
alzheimers-disease.description: A progressive disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.

vertigo.name: Vertigo
vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness.
vertigo.causes: Inner ear problems or nerve issues.

dengue.name: Dengue
dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever and severe body pain.
dengue.causes: Dengue virus transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes.
dengue.when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain, bleeding, or persistent vomiting.

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.description: A life-threatening disease transmitted through mosquito bites.
malaria.when_to_seek_help: Recurring fever with chills or confusion.

tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs but can affect other organs.
tuberculosis.when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 2 weeks or coughing blood.

typhoid-fever.name: Typhoid Fever
typhoid-fever.description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.
typhoid-fever.when_to_seek_help: Persistent high fever or severe weakness.

cholera.name: Cholera
cholera.description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by contaminated water.

hepatitis-b.name: Hepatitis B
hepatitis-b.description: A viral infection that attacks the liver.

hiv-aids.name: HIV/AIDS
hiv-aids.description: A chronic condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus that weakens the immune system.
hiv-aids.when_to_seek_help: Recurrent infections or unexplained weight loss.

chickenpox.name: Chickenpox
chickenpox.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.

back-pain.name: Back Pain
back-pain.description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back.
back-pain.causes: Muscle strain, poor posture, or injury.
back-pain.when_to_seek_help: Severe or persistent pain lasting more than a few weeks.

sciatica.name: Sciatica
sciatica.description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve from the lower back to the leg.
sciatica.when_to_seek_help: Severe pain or weakness in the leg.

arthritis.name: Arthritis
arthritis.description: Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness.
arthritis.causes: Joint wear and tear or autoimmune conditions.

osteoporosis.name: Osteoporosis
osteoporosis.description: A condition characterized by weakened bones and increased fracture risk.
osteoporosis.causes: Low bone density due to aging or hormonal changes.

gout.name: Gout
gout.description: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe joint pain.

fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
fibromyalgia.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
fibromyalgia.causes: Abnormal pain processing in the brain.

type-2-diabetes.name: Type 2 Diabetes
type-2-diabetes.description: A chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.
type-2-diabetes.causes: Insulin resistance leading to high blood sugar levels.
type-2-diabetes.when_to_seek_help: Persistently high blood sugar levels or symptoms of diabetes.

obesity.name: Obesity
obesity.description: A condition involving excessive body fat that increases health risks.
obesity.causes: Excess calorie intake and lack of physical activity.

thyroid-disorders.name: Thyroid Disorders
thyroid-disorders.causes: Hormonal imbalance due to thyroid dysfunction.
thyroid-disorders.when_to_seek_help: Unexplained weight changes or persistent fatigue.

depression.name: Depression
depression.description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
depression.causes: Chemical imbalance, prolonged stress, or traumatic experiences.
depression.when_to_seek_help: Thoughts of self-harm or inability to function in daily life.

anxiety-disorder.name: Anxiety Disorder
anxiety-disorder.description: A condition involving excessive fear, worry, or nervousness.
anxiety-disorder.when_to_seek_help: Anxiety that interferes with daily activities.

insomnia.name: Insomnia
insomnia.description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
insomnia.causes: Stress, anxiety, or poor sleep habits.
insomnia.when_to_seek_help: Persistent sleep problems affecting daily life.

acne.name: Acne
acne.description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
acne.causes: Hormonal changes and excess oil production.

eczema.name: Eczema
eczema.description: A condition causing inflamed, itchy, and irritated skin.
eczema.causes: Immune system dysfunction and allergic reactions.
eczema.when_to_seek_help: Severe itching or signs of skin infection.

psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
psoriasis.description: An autoimmune condition causing rapid buildup of skin cells.

skin-cancer-melanoma.name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
skin-cancer-melanoma.description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops from pigment-producing cells.
skin-cancer-melanoma.when_to_seek_help: Changes in size, shape, or color of a mole.

glaucoma.name: Glaucoma
glaucoma.description: An eye condition that damages the optic nerve, often due to increased eye pressure.
glaucoma.causes: Increased intraocular pressure damaging the optic nerve.
glaucoma.when_to_seek_help: Sudden vision changes or severe eye pain.

cataracts.name: Cataracts
cataracts.description: Clouding of the eye lens that leads to blurred or reduced vision.
cataracts.causes: Aging and prolonged exposure to ultraviolet light.

conjunctivitis.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
conjunctivitis.description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva causing redness and irritation in the eye.
conjunctivitis.causes: Viral or bacterial infection, or allergic reaction.
conjunctivitis.when_to_seek_help: Severe pain, vision changes, or symptoms worsening.

breast-cancer.name: Breast Cancer
breast-cancer.description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.
breast-cancer.when_to_seek_help: New breast lump or noticeable changes.

colorectal-cancer.name: Colorectal Cancer
colorectal-cancer.description: Cancer affecting the colon or rectum.
colorectal-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Persistent bowel changes or rectal bleeding.

prostate-cancer.name: Prostate Cancer
prostate-cancer.description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland.

liver-cancer.name: Liver Cancer
liver-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the liver cells.
liver-cancer.causes: Chronic liver disease or hepatitis infection.
liver-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Persistent abdominal pain or yellowing of skin.

pancreatic-cancer.name: Pancreatic Cancer
pancreatic-cancer.description: Cancer that forms in the pancreas.
pancreatic-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Unexplained weight loss and persistent pain.

leukemia.name: Leukemia
leukemia.description: Cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

brain-cancer.name: Brain Cancer
brain-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in brain tissue.

ovarian-cancer.name: Ovarian Cancer
ovarian-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries.

cervical-cancer.name: Cervical Cancer
cervical-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the cervix.

thyroid-cancer.name: Thyroid Cancer
thyroid-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the thyroid gland.

kidney-cancer.name: Kidney Cancer
kidney-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the kidneys.

bladder-cancer.name: Bladder Cancer
bladder-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the bladder lining.
bladder-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Blood in urine or urinary pain.

oral-cancer.name: Oral Cancer
oral-cancer.description: Cancer affecting the mouth or throat.

anemia.name: Anemia
anemia.description: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells.

urinary-tract-infection.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
urinary-tract-infection.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.

Diseases.title: Disease Information Hub
Diseases.subtitle: Learn about common diseases, their symptoms, causes, and prevention

acidReflux.name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
acidReflux.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the food pipe, causing irritation.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
Feeling of a lump in the throat
acidReflux.causes: GERD is most often caused by a weakened lower esophageal sphincter, allowing stomach acid to flow back into the esophagus. It may also be triggered by obesity, hiatal hernia, pregnancy, or delayed stomach emptying.
prevention_tips: Avoid spicy, fatty, and acidic foods
Do not lie down immediately after eating
acidReflux.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if symptoms occur frequently, interfere with daily life, or if you experience difficulty swallowing, unexplained weight loss, vomiting blood, or severe chest pain.

acne.name: Acne
acne.description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, leading to pimples and inflammation.
acne.causes: Acne develops when excess oil, dead skin cells, and bacteria clog hair follicles. Hormonal changes, stress, and certain medications can worsen this process.
risk_factors: Touching or rubbing the skin frequently
acne.when_to_seek_help: Consult a dermatologist if acne is severe, painful, leaves scars, or does not improve with over-the-counter treatments.

allergicRhinitis.name: Allergic Rhinitis
allergicRhinitis.description: An allergic reaction that causes sneezing, congestion, runny nose, and itchy eyes due to airborne allergens.
allergicRhinitis.causes: Allergic rhinitis occurs when the immune system overreacts to allergens such as pollen, dust mites, mold, or pet dander.
prevention_tips: Keep windows closed during pollen season
Wash hands and face after outdoor exposure
allergicRhinitis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if symptoms persist, disturb sleep, or cause breathing problems or frequent sinus infections.

alzheimersDisease.name: Alzheimer's Disease
alzheimersDisease.description: A progressive neurological disorder that gradually destroys memory, thinking skills, and the ability to carry out daily activities.
alzheimersDisease.causes: Alzheimer’s disease is caused by abnormal buildup of proteins in the brain that damage and destroy nerve cells.
alzheimersDisease.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if memory loss, confusion, or personality changes begin interfering with daily activities or safety.

anemia.name: Anemia
anemia.description: A condition in which the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to tissues.
anemia.causes: Anemia is commonly caused by iron deficiency, vitamin deficiencies, blood loss, or chronic diseases.
anemia.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if you experience severe fatigue, chest pain, shortness of breath, or fainting.

anxietyDisorder.name: Anxiety Disorder
anxietyDisorder.description: A mental health condition characterized by excessive fear, worry, and nervousness that interferes with daily activities.
anxietyDisorder.causes: Anxiety disorders develop due to genetic, chemical, and environmental factors.
anxietyDisorder.when_to_seek_help: Seek professional help if anxiety interferes with work, relationships, or sleep.

arthritis.name: Arthritis
arthritis.description: A condition characterized by inflammation of one or more joints, leading to pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
arthritis.causes: Arthritis is caused by joint inflammation resulting from cartilage wear, autoimmune disorders, or infections.
arthritis.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if joint pain or stiffness persists or limits daily activities.

asthma.name: Asthma
asthma.description: A chronic lung disease that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways, making breathing difficult.
asthma.causes: Asthma is caused by airway inflammation triggered by allergens, infections, exercise, cold air, or pollution.
asthma.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if breathing becomes extremely difficult or inhalers stop working.

backPain.name: Back Pain
backPain.description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back, often caused by muscle strain or spine problems.
backPain.causes: Back pain is commonly caused by muscle strain, poor posture, herniated discs, or spinal degeneration.
backPain.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if pain lasts more than a few weeks or causes numbness or weakness.

bronchitis.name: Bronchitis
bronchitis.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to and from the lungs.
bronchitis.causes: Bronchitis is caused by infections or long-term exposure to irritants like smoke.
bronchitis.when_to_seek_help: Seek care if cough lasts more than 3 weeks or breathing difficulty occurs.

copd.name: COPD
copd.description: A progressive lung disease that blocks airflow and makes breathing difficult.
copd.causes: COPD is mainly caused by long-term exposure to tobacco smoke and pollutants.
copd.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if breathing becomes very difficult or lips turn blue.

cardiacArrest.name: Cardiac Arrest
cardiacArrest.description: A sudden loss of heart function that stops blood flow to the brain and body.
cardiacArrest.causes: Cardiac arrest is caused by an electrical malfunction in the heart.
cardiacArrest.when_to_seek_help: This is a medical emergency. Call emergency services immediately.

cataracts.name: Cataracts
cataracts.description: A condition in which the normally clear lens of the eye becomes cloudy, leading to vision impairment.
cataracts.causes: Cataracts develop due to aging, eye injury, or long-term UV exposure.
cataracts.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if vision becomes cloudy or glare affects daily life.

cervicalCancer.name: Cervical Cancer
cervicalCancer.description: A type of cancer that develops in the cervix, most commonly caused by HPV infection.
cervicalCancer.causes: Cervical cancer is caused by persistent HPV infection.
cervicalCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for abnormal vaginal bleeding or pelvic pain.

chickenpox.name: Chickenpox
chickenpox.description: A contagious viral infection that causes itchy blisters and flu-like symptoms.
chickenpox.causes: Chickenpox is caused by the varicella-zoster virus.
chickenpox.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if fever is high or rash spreads to eyes.

cholera.name: Cholera
cholera.description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by contaminated food or water.
cholera.causes: Cholera is caused by Vibrio cholerae bacteria in contaminated water.
cholera.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if severe diarrhea or dehydration occurs.

chronicKidneyDisease.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
chronicKidneyDisease.description: A long-term condition in which the kidneys gradually lose their ability to filter waste from the blood.
chronicKidneyDisease.causes: Chronic kidney disease is commonly caused by diabetes and high blood pressure.
chronicKidneyDisease.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if swelling, fatigue, or urination changes persist.

colorectalCancer.name: Colorectal Cancer
colorectalCancer.description: Cancer that affects the colon or rectum, often starting as abnormal growths called polyps.
colorectalCancer.causes: Colorectal cancer develops when abnormal cells grow uncontrollably in the colon or rectum.
colorectalCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if blood in stool or bowel changes persist.

conjunctivitis.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
conjunctivitis.description: An inflammation of the membrane covering the white of the eye and eyelids.
conjunctivitis.causes: Conjunctivitis is caused by infections, allergies, or irritants.
conjunctivitis.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if vision loss or severe pain occurs.

constipation.name: Constipation
constipation.description: A condition where bowel movements are infrequent or difficult.
constipation.causes: Constipation is caused by low fiber, dehydration, and inactivity.
constipation.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if constipation lasts over two weeks.

coronaryArteryDisease.name: Coronary Artery Disease
coronaryArteryDisease.description: A condition in which coronary arteries are narrowed or blocked.
coronaryArteryDisease.causes: Coronary artery disease is caused by plaque buildup in arteries.
coronaryArteryDisease.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if chest pain is severe or persistent.

dengueFever.name: Dengue Fever
dengueFever.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection that causes high fever and severe body pain.
dengueFever.causes: Dengue fever is caused by the dengue virus transmitted through mosquito bites.
dengueFever.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for severe abdominal pain, bleeding, or extreme weakness.

depression.name: Depression
depression.description: A mental health disorder marked by persistent sadness and loss of interest.
depression.causes: Depression develops due to chemical imbalances and emotional or environmental factors.
depression.when_to_seek_help: Get immediate help if you have suicidal thoughts.

eczema.name: Eczema
eczema.description: A chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, inflamed skin.
eczema.causes: Eczema is caused by immune overreaction and weak skin barrier.
eczema.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if eczema becomes infected or painful.

epilepsy.name: Epilepsy
epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.
epilepsy.causes: Epilepsy may result from brain injury, genetic factors, or infections.
epilepsy.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if seizures last more than five minutes.

fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
fibromyalgia.description: A disorder causing widespread pain and fatigue.
fibromyalgia.causes: Fibromyalgia is caused by abnormal pain processing in the brain.
fibromyalgia.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if pain and fatigue persist.

foodPoisoning.name: Food Poisoning
foodPoisoning.description: An illness caused by contaminated food.
foodPoisoning.causes: Food poisoning is caused by harmful bacteria or viruses in food.
foodPoisoning.when_to_seek_help: Get medical care if dehydration or bloody stools occur.

gastritis.name: Gastritis
gastritis.causes: Gastritis is caused by H. pylori, alcohol, or painkillers.
gastritis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for vomiting blood or black stools.

glaucoma.name: Glaucoma
glaucoma.description: An eye condition that damages the optic nerve.
glaucoma.causes: Glaucoma is caused by increased eye pressure.
glaucoma.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for sudden vision loss.

gout.name: Gout
gout.description: A form of arthritis caused by uric acid crystal buildup.
gout.causes: Gout occurs due to excess uric acid in blood.
gout.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for sudden severe joint pain.

hivAids.name: HIV/AIDS
hivAids.description: A viral infection that weakens the immune system and reduces the body’s ability to fight infections.
hivAids.causes: HIV is caused by the human immunodeficiency virus transmitted through blood and sexual contact.
hivAids.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if exposed to HIV or symptoms persist.

heartAttack.name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
heartAttack.description: A life-threatening condition that occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked.
heartAttack.causes: Heart attack occurs when plaque blocks blood flow to the heart.
heartAttack.when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately for chest pain or breathlessness.

heartFailure.name: Heart Failure
heartFailure.description: A condition where the heart cannot pump enough blood.
heartFailure.causes: Heart failure develops when heart muscle is weakened.
heartFailure.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for sudden weight gain or severe breathlessness.

hepatitisB.name: Hepatitis B
hepatitisB.description: A viral infection that attacks the liver.
hepatitisB.causes: Hepatitis B spreads through blood or sexual contact.
hepatitisB.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for jaundice or abdominal pain.

hypertension.name: Hypertension
hypertension.description: A condition where blood pressure remains high over time.
hypertension.causes: Hypertension is caused by genetics, poor diet, inactivity, and stress.
hypertension.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if BP stays high or symptoms appear.

insomnia.name: Insomnia
insomnia.description: A sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall or stay asleep.
insomnia.causes: Insomnia is caused by stress, anxiety, poor sleep habits, or illness.
insomnia.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if insomnia lasts weeks or affects daily life.

irritableBowelSyndrome.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
irritableBowelSyndrome.description: A chronic disorder affecting the large intestine.
irritableBowelSyndrome.causes: IBS is caused by gut-brain communication problems.
irritableBowelSyndrome.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if symptoms are severe or persistent.

jaundice.name: Jaundice
jaundice.description: A condition where the skin and eyes turn yellow.
jaundice.causes: Jaundice occurs due to liver or bile duct problems.
jaundice.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if yellowing of skin or eyes occurs.

kidneyCancer.name: Kidney Cancer
kidneyCancer.description: A type of cancer that begins in the kidneys.
kidneyCancer.causes: Kidney cancer occurs when kidney cells grow uncontrollably.
kidneyCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if blood in urine or persistent pain occurs.

leukemia.name: Leukemia
leukemia.causes: Leukemia occurs when bone marrow produces abnormal white cells.
leukemia.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for fatigue or frequent infections.

liverCancer.name: Liver Cancer
liverCancer.description: Cancer that begins in the liver.
liverCancer.causes: Liver cancer is caused by chronic liver disease.
liverCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for abdominal swelling or jaundice.

lungCancer.name: Lung Cancer
lungCancer.description: Cancer that begins in the lungs.
lungCancer.causes: Lung cancer is mainly caused by smoking and pollution.
lungCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if cough or chest pain persists.

lymphoma.name: Lymphoma
lymphoma.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system.
lymphoma.causes: Lymphoma occurs when lymphocytes grow uncontrollably.
lymphoma.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if swollen lymph nodes persist.

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.causes: Malaria is caused by Plasmodium parasites.
malaria.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for fever after mosquito bites.

migraine.name: Migraine
migraine.description: A neurological condition causing intense headaches.
migraine.causes: Migraines are caused by brain chemical changes.
migraine.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if headaches are severe or frequent.

obesity.name: Obesity
obesity.description: A condition involving excessive body fat.
obesity.causes: Obesity is caused by excess calorie intake and inactivity.
obesity.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if weight affects health.

oralCancer.name: Oral Cancer
oralCancer.description: Cancer that develops in the mouth, tongue, or throat.
oralCancer.causes: Oral cancer is mainly caused by tobacco, alcohol, and HPV.
oralCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if mouth sores last more than two weeks.

osteoporosis.name: Osteoporosis
osteoporosis.description: A condition where bones become weak and fragile.
osteoporosis.causes: Osteoporosis is caused by bone density loss.
osteoporosis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for fractures or posture changes.

ovarianCancer.name: Ovarian Cancer
ovarianCancer.description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries.
ovarianCancer.causes: Ovarian cancer is caused by genetic or hormonal factors.
ovarianCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if bloating or pelvic pain persists.

parkinsonsDisease.name: Parkinson’s Disease
parkinsonsDisease.causes: Parkinson’s is caused by loss of dopamine-producing cells.
parkinsonsDisease.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if tremors or stiffness appear.

pepticUlcer.name: Peptic Ulcer
pepticUlcer.description: Open sores in the stomach or intestine lining.
pepticUlcer.causes: Peptic ulcers are caused by H. pylori or NSAIDs.
pepticUlcer.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for vomiting blood or black stools.

pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.
pneumonia.causes: Pneumonia is caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
pneumonia.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if breathing becomes difficult.

prostateCancer.name: Prostate Cancer
prostateCancer.description: Cancer that develops in the prostate gland.
prostateCancer.causes: Prostate cancer is caused by abnormal prostate cell growth.
prostateCancer.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for urinary or pelvic symptoms.

psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
psoriasis.causes: Psoriasis occurs when the immune system attacks skin cells.
psoriasis.when_to_seek_help: See a dermatologist if psoriasis becomes painful or widespread.

rheumatoidArthritis.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
rheumatoidArthritis.description: An autoimmune disease that causes joint inflammation.
rheumatoidArthritis.causes: Rheumatoid arthritis occurs when immune system attacks joints.
rheumatoidArthritis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if joint pain persists.

sciatica.name: Sciatica
sciatica.description: Pain that radiates along the sciatic nerve.
sciatica.causes: Sciatica occurs due to nerve compression.
sciatica.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if pain is severe or causes weakness.

skinCancerMelanoma.name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
skinCancerMelanoma.description: A dangerous form of skin cancer caused by UV damage.
skinCancerMelanoma.causes: Melanoma is caused by DNA damage from UV radiation.
skinCancerMelanoma.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if a mole changes or bleeds.

sinusitis.name: Sinusitis
sinusitis.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing congestion and pain.
sinusitis.causes: Sinusitis is caused by infection, allergies, or blocked sinuses.
sinusitis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if symptoms last more than 10 days.

stomachCancer.name: Stomach Cancer
stomachCancer.description: Cancer that develops in the stomach lining.
stomachCancer.causes: Stomach cancer is caused by chronic inflammation or H. pylori infection.
stomachCancer.when_to_seek_help: Seek care for stomach pain or blood in vomit.

stroke.name: Stroke
stroke.description: A medical emergency caused by interrupted blood supply to the brain.
stroke.causes: Stroke occurs when a blood vessel to the brain is blocked or ruptured.
stroke.when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if stroke symptoms appear.

thyroidDisorders.name: Thyroid Disorders
thyroidDisorders.description: Conditions that affect thyroid hormone balance.
thyroidDisorders.causes: Thyroid disorders are caused by autoimmune disease or hormone imbalance.
thyroidDisorders.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for unexplained weight or mood changes.

tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection affecting the lungs.
tuberculosis.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if cough lasts more than 3 weeks.

typhoidFever.name: Typhoid Fever
typhoidFever.description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food or water.
typhoidFever.causes: Typhoid is caused by Salmonella bacteria.
typhoidFever.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if fever lasts more than 3 days.

urinaryTractInfection.name: Urinary Tract Infection
urinaryTractInfection.description: An infection of the urinary system.
urinaryTractInfection.causes: UTIs occur when bacteria enter the urinary tract.
urinaryTractInfection.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for pain, fever, or blood in urine.

varicoseVeins.name: Varicose Veins
varicoseVeins.description: Swollen twisted veins usually in the legs.
varicoseVeins.causes: Varicose veins occur when valves fail.
varicoseVeins.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if veins become painful or bleed.

vertigo.name: Vertigo
vertigo.description: A spinning sensation due to balance problems.
vertigo.causes: Vertigo is caused by inner ear or nerve problems.
vertigo.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for severe or persistent dizziness.

visionImpairment.name: Vision Impairment
visionImpairment.description: Partial or complete loss of eyesight.
visionImpairment.causes: Vision impairment is caused by eye disease, injury, or aging.
visionImpairment.when_to_seek_help: See an eye doctor if vision worsens suddenly.

vitaminDDeficiency.name: Vitamin D Deficiency
vitaminDDeficiency.description: A condition where the body lacks enough vitamin D.
vitaminDDeficiency.causes: Vitamin D deficiency occurs due to lack of sunlight or poor absorption.
vitaminDDeficiency.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor for bone pain or frequent illness.

whoopingCough.name: Whooping Cough
whoopingCough.causes: Whooping cough is caused by Bordetella pertussis bacteria.
whoopingCough.when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if coughing causes breathing trouble.

yellowFever.name: Yellow Fever
yellowFever.causes: Yellow fever is caused by a virus spread by mosquitoes.
yellowFever.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care for yellowing or bleeding.

Prevention.subtitle: Simple steps for a healthier life and disease prevention

nutrition.title: Nutrition
tips: Eat a balanced diet rich in fruits and vegetables
Limit processed foods and added sugars
Stay hydrated — drink 8–10 glasses of water daily
Include whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats
Reduce salt intake to prevent hypertension
Avoid excessive caffeine and alcohol

physicalActivity.title: Physical Activity
tips: Aim for at least 30 minutes of exercise daily
Take regular breaks from sitting every hour
Include strength training 2–3 times per week
Practice stretching and flexibility exercises
Walk or cycle instead of driving when possible
Use stairs instead of elevators

mentalHealth.title: Mental Health
tips: Practice stress management techniques
Get adequate sleep (7–9 hours per night)
Maintain social connections and relationships
Practice mindfulness or meditation
Seek help when feeling overwhelmed
Engage in hobbies and activities you enjoy

hygiene.title: Hygiene
tips: Wash hands frequently with soap for 20 seconds
Cover mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing
Keep living and working spaces clean
Avoid touching your face frequently

diabetic-emergency.about: Low or high blood sugar can cause serious complications. Quick recognition and action is important.
steps: Check blood sugar if glucometer available
If LOW sugar: Give sugar immediately (juice, candy, glucose tablets)
Have person sit or lie down
If HIGH sugar: Offer water, call doctor
Call 108 if unconscious or having seizure
dos: Give sugar for low blood sugar
donts: Don’t give unconscious person food or drink
Don’t assume intoxication — check medical ID

burn-emergency.about: Serious burns require immediate cooling and medical attention to prevent complications and reduce damage.
recognize: Burns on face, hands, joints, or genitals
Deep burns with no pain (nerve damage)
steps: Cool burn with cool (not ice cold) running water for 10–20 minutes
Remove jewelry and tight clothing before swelling
Treat for shock — keep person warm and lying down
dos: Seek medical care for serious burns
donts: Don’t apply butter, oil, or ointments
Don’t give food or drink if severe

seizure-emergency.about: During a seizure, the person may shake, lose consciousness, or become confused.
steps: Move objects away to prevent injury
Call 108 if seizure lasts more than 5 minutes

heart-attack.about: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. Every second counts.
recognize: Pain in arm, jaw, or back

stroke.about: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is interrupted. Time lost is brain lost.
steps: Do not give food or drink

cpr.about: Immediate CPR can double or triple chances of survival.
steps: Push hard and fast in center of chest

choking.about: Quick action with Heimlich maneuver can save a life.

anaphylaxis.about: Requires immediate epinephrine injection and emergency care.
steps: Lay person flat with legs raised
